Pyrefiends are Slayer monsters that require level 30 Slayer to kill and are not to be confused with a pyrelord, a Summoning familiar. They are the weaker elemental cousin of the waterfiend but stronger than some icefiends, except the ones at Ghorrock Fortress. Also, they have very similar drops to those of lesser demons and harpie bug swarms and are notable for their relatively high drop rate for medium clue scrolls.

A variant of pyrefiends can be found in Soul Wars. These count for Slayer tasks.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Fremennik Slayer Dungeon38None13Maplink
God Wars Dungeon92None4Maplink
Smoke Dungeon38None23Maplink

Strengths and weaknesses[edit | edit source]

Despite their level, they have higher accuracy than many other monsters of a similar level, so food is recommended for lower levelled players. It is also recommended that either mage or range is used, since they have moderate melee defence due to being mage monsters.

Pyrefiends are weak against bolts. Use of the Defence abilities work well, especially Resonance. Note that a dwarf multicannon cannot be used in any of their locations except for the Smoke Dungeon.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 26,268 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Pyrefiend kill is worth 1,610 coins.

This monster has access to the rare drop table.
Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but they will increase the chance of accessing the rare drop table and may also improve the loot received from it.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • update 1 August 2022 (Update):
    • Pyrefiends have been graphically updated.
  • ninja 26 August 2014 (Update):
    • Pyrefiend and icefiend models and animations have been updated to use the God Wars models and animations.
  • update 5 September 2012 (Update):
    • Pyrefiends in the God Wars Dungeon have been graphically updated.
  • update 4 October 2011 (Update):
    • Demons in Daemonheim now drop impious, accursed and infernal ashes.
  • patch 9 November 2009 (Update):
    • Greatly sped up the death animation of pyrefiends.
  • hidden 5 June 2008 (Update):
    • Pyrefiends have been graphically updated.
  • update 26 January 2005 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The pyrefiends in the Soul Wars tutorial have a life point and are weak to crush. Nomad doesn't let players attack these though.
  • Pyrefiends used to have significant stalling on their combat animations, causing them to appear in a different tile from where they actually were. This was reduced with their graphical update in 2014.
